intro: Newcastelia chrysophylla, commonly known as the golden leaf newcastelia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow foliage and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively rare in the wild.
